sentence.text: The proposed mechanisms of analgesic action of antihistaminics are reviewed and discussed.
There is considerable evidence suggesting that histaminergic and serotoninergic central pathways are involved in nociception and that antihistaminic drugs can modulate their responses (1).
The evidence for a role for norepinephrine and dopamine and the effects of antihistaminics on them are less well established.
A greater understanding of pain mechanisms will aid in elucidating the role of antihistaminics in analgesia.
